ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders package

Submodules

ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.rosbags module

This module implements a class to load decompressed rosbags.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.rosbags.RosbagLoader(data_path: str)[source]

Bases: object

Implements some useful functions to load decompressed rosbags.

It loads EKF and IMU data.

ekf

the EKF data (timestamp, position and orientation).

Type:

np.ndarray

ekf_times

the float timestamps for each EKF entry.

Type:

np.ndarray

imu

the IMU data (timestamp and orientation).

Type:

np.ndarray

imu_times

the float timestamps for each IMU entry.

Type:

np.ndarray

Initializes the rosbag loader.

Parameters:

data_path (str) –

the path to the the upper folder where the compressed and the extracted data are storaged. It is expected a folder arrangement similar to:

/data
/rosbag
/ekf

  • ekf.csv file

/imu

  • imu.csv file

/svo
/depth

  • PNG images

/rgb

  • PNG images

_get_csv_and_times(csv_path: str) → Tuple[_SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes]][source]

Loads a CSV file and constructs the float timestamp for each entry.

It is expected that the timestamp seconds and nanoseconds are in the first and second columns, respectively. It is also expected that the first line of the file is used for data description (it’s skipped).

Parameters:

csv_path (str) – the path to the CSV file.

Returns:

  • data (np.ndarray) – the data loaded from the CSV file.

  • times (np.ndarray) – the float timestamps for each entry.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.svo_zed module

This module implements a class to load decompressed SVO files.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.svo_zed.SVOZedLoader(data_path: str)[source]

Bases: object

Implements some useful functions to load data from decompressed svo files.

It loads RGB and depth images.

rgb_imgs

the sorted names of the RGB images.

Type:

list

rgb_times

the float timestamps for each RGB image.

Type:

np.ndarray

depth_imgs

the sorted names of the depth images.

Type:

list

depth_times

the float timestamps for each depth image.

Type:

np.ndarray

Initializes the decompressed SVO loader.

Gets the images list and their timestamps.

Parameters:

data_path (str) –

the path to the the upper folder where the compressed and the extracted data are storaged. It is expected a folder arrangement similar to:

/data
/rosbag
/ekf

  • ekf.csv file

/imu

  • imu.csv file

/svo
/depth

  • PNG images

/rgb

  • PNG images

_get_image_set_times(image_filenames: List) → _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Extract the timestamps from image filenames.

Is expected that the filename has the format ‘($secs)_n($nsecs).png’, where ($secs) and ($nsecs) contains the seconds and nanoseconds from the timestamp.

Parameters:

image_filenames (list) – contains the images filenames.

Returns:

times (np.ndarray) – the timestamp for each image storaged in float format.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.sync_loader module

This implements a class to load and synchronize data from rosbags and SVO files.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.input_utils.loaders.sync_loader.SynchronizedLoader(data_path: str)[source]

Bases: object

Implements loading and synchronizing data from rosbags and SVO files.

data_path

the path to the the upper folder where the compressed and the extracted data are storaged.

Type:

str

data

all the data from the extracted files. Images still need to be loaded.

Type:

a dict [str, np.ndarray]

times

all the data timestamps from the extracted files.

Type:

a dict [str, np.ndarray]

low_freq_topic

the topic with the least amount of data. It is used to synchronize the others.

Type:

str

Initializes the loader.

Parameters:

data_path (str) –

the path to the the upper folder where the compressed and the extracted data are storaged. It is expected a folder arrangement similar to:

/data
/rosbag
/ekf

  • ekf.csv file

/imu

  • imu.csv file

/svo
/depth

  • PNG images

/rgb

  • PNG images

_get_low_freq_topic(times: Dict) → str[source]

Gets the low frequency topic from all sources.

Finds the low frequency topic by checking the size of the timestamp Numpy array. This topic will be used as the step for synchronize the others.

Parameters:

times (a dict [str, np.ndarray]) – the timestamps of each topic.

get_sync_data(skip_frames: int = 0) → Generator[source]

Yields the rosbag and svo data synchronized.

Parameters:

skip_frames (int) – the desired amount of frames that will be skipped at the start.
